resources.string: When someone messages you, you\'ll see it here.
Start a new conversation from someone\'s profile! üí¨
When you message someone, it will show up here.
Tip: Try Explore ‚Üí tap a profile ‚Üí Message (mock).
Try a different search or switch back to All.
Direct Messages are disabled for kids mode (under 13). A parent can change this in Settings ‚Üí Safety & Parental Controls.
If something feels wrong, report abusive messages. Under-13 accounts can‚Äôt use DMs.
They won‚Äôt be able to message you, and this conversation will be hidden.
They‚Äôll be able to message you again.
Too many messages. Please slow down.
Message failed to send. Tap and retry.
View your earned achievements and goals.
Remove ads and support the developers.
This will permanently delete all posts from the server. This action cannot be undone.
Set app language manually. Requires app restart.
This will permanently delete this story. This action cannot be undone.
This post may contain sensitive content
Premium upgrades are not wired in this demo build.
This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this post?
We\'re so glad you\'re here. This is a safe space designed for neurodivergent minds.
I totally agree with that! Great perspective.
\@%s mentioned you: \"Check out this accessibility tip!\"
%s shared your post about ADHD tips with %d followers
Remember to take breaks! You\'ve been active for a while. üíô
We\'ve hidden some content that may not be suitable. You can adjust this in settings.
üåà Just finished my rainbow puzzle! 1000 pieces completed! Who else loves puzzles? üß©
Today I learned that dinosaurs lived millions of years ago! ü¶ï T-Rex is my favorite!
My cat learned a new trick today! She can high-five now! üê±‚úã So proud of her!
üéÆ Just beat my high score in my favorite game! Practice really does make perfect! üèÜ
üåà Made a friendship bracelet for my best friend! The colors are so pretty together! üíï
üêï My dog is my best helper! He sits with me when I do homework and it makes me feel calm! üêæ
üìñ Reading time is the BEST! I\'m on chapter 10 of my favorite book series! Who else loves reading? üìö
üé® Art class was so fun today! We painted sunsets and mine has ALL the colors! üåÖ
Just had a breakthrough on my project! Hyperfocus is a superpower when you can direct it. Late night coding sessions hit different.
Trying out my new weighted vest today. Instant calm, highly recommend for sensory regulation! Also helps with my anxiety during exams.
Dating with ADHD is wild. Hyperfocusing on someone new then completely forgetting to text back for 3 days üòÖ Anyone else?
School stress is real right now. Midterms + social anxiety = wanting to hide in my room for a week. At least my noise-canceling headphones help.
Need a quiet space. Going into Overload Mode for the rest of the afternoon. See you all tomorrow. #QuietMode
Just finished sorting all my project files into categorized folders. The visual order is immensely satisfying. My therapist says this is a healthy coping mechanism.
Workplace accommodations are finally in place! Took 6 months of advocacy but got my quiet workspace approved. HR was surprisingly supportive once I provided the documentation.
Adulting with ADHD: Forgot to pay rent again, but somehow remembered every line of dialogue from a movie I watched 10 years ago. My landlord is not amused.

PSA: Getting diagnosed as an adult is valid. Got mine at 34 and suddenly my entire life makes sense. The grief of \'what could have been\' is real but so is the relief of finally understanding yourself.
Hey! Love your posts about sensory tips! üíú
Thanks so much! Your content is super helpful too!
Quick question about that fidget toy you recommended?
Sure, happy to help! What would you like to know?
‚ú® Finally got my sensory-friendly workspace set up! Noise-canceling headphones, soft lighting, and my weighted lap pad. Game changer for focus! üéßüí°
Reminder: Your brain works differently, not wrong. üß†üíú Embrace your unique way of processing the world!
Just discovered body doubling on NeuroComet and WOW. Studied for 3 hours straight with my virtual study buddy! üìöüéâ Anyone else find this helpful?
My stim toy collection is growing! üåà These fidget tools have helped me so much in meetings. No shame in stimming! ‚ú®
Pro tip: Create a \'launch pad\' by your door with everything you need for the day. Keys, wallet, meds, snacks - all in one spot! üöÄ ADHD life hack #247
Today\'s win: I remembered to eat lunch! üéä Setting phone alarms for basic needs is self-care. Don\'t let anyone tell you otherwise. üí™
Hey, how are you feeling today?
Did you see that new scam post? Don\'t fall for it!
Thanks for the warning. I saw the phishing attempt.
Hey! I saw your post about executive function struggles. I totally relate!
Right?! Some days are just harder than others.
Have you tried body doubling? It really helps me stay on task.
I\'ve heard of it but never tried. How does it work for you?
I just video call a friend while we both work on our own stuff. The accountability helps!
Yo! That productivity hack you shared was üî•
Glad it helped! The Pomodoro technique is a game changer.
I modified it to 25 min work / 10 min stim break. Works way better for my ADHD brain.
That\'s genius! Mind if I share that tip in my next post?
üé® Just finished a new painting during my hyperfocus session!
OMG I need to see it! You\'re so talented!
Thanks! It\'s all blues and purples - very calming colors. I\'ll post it later today.
Those are my favorite colors too! They really help when I\'m overstimulated.
Hi there! Wanted to share a grounding technique that helped me today.
I\'m all ears! Been having a rough week with anxiety.
Try the 5-4-3-2-1 method: 5 things you see, 4 you hear, 3 you touch, 2 you smell, 1 you taste.
This is really helpful, thank you! üíô
Anytime! We\'re all in this together. ü§ó
Just got the new mechanical keyboard! The clicks are SO satisfying üéπ
Ooooh which switches did you get?
Cherry MX Blues! The tactile feedback is *chef\'s kiss* for my stimming needs.
I\'ve been eyeing those! Do they help you focus while coding?
Absolutely! The rhythmic clicking is like a built-in focus soundtrack. Highly recommend!
Low spoon day today üò¥ How are you managing?
Same here. Decided to cancel all non-essential plans.
That\'s smart! Self-care isn\'t selfish. Rest up! üíú

Tap the ‚ôæÔ∏è infinity logo on the login screen to quickly enable/disable animations
Tap the version info 7 times in Settings to unlock the secret Rainbow Brain theme!
Enable Dark Mode + Autism Low Stimulation theme for the calmest experience
Try Lexend or Atkinson Hyperlegible fonts - designed for neurodivergent readers
Disable all animations in Settings > Animations and use the Calm or Overload theme
Use ADHD Task Mode theme + Hyperfocus for minimal distractions
Set up Parental Controls with a PIN to manage screen time and content
The logo automatically celebrates holidays and ND awareness events with special colors!
Explore themes for ADHD, Autism, Anxiety, Colorblind, Low Vision, and your current mood
Choose from dyslexia-friendly, ADHD-friendly, and accessibility fonts in Settings > Font & Reading
Watch the getting started guide again
Unlock stim-friendly games by earning achievements
This game is still being developed. Check back soon!
Pop satisfying bubbles for a calming stim experience
Tap the bubbles to pop them! ‚ú®
Spin to your heart\'s content - no limits, just vibes
Swipe to spin! The faster you swipe, the faster it goes üåÄ
Watch relaxing color gradients flow and mix
Tap anywhere to change the colors
Tap patterns in sequence - great for focus training
Draw endless patterns that never fade - pure stim bliss
Watch beautiful raindrops fall with soothing visuals
Check out the %s community on NeuroComet! üß†‚ú®
Learn the basics and community guidelines
ADHD, Autism, Anxiety, Colorblind, and Mood themes
Disable animations for a calmer experience
Special themes for ND awareness days
Screen time, bedtime mode, content filtering
Unlock Rainbow Brain, reduce eye strain & more
Books and articles recommended by members
üß† Just discovered the power of body doubling! Working alongside someone (even virtually) helps me stay on task so much better.
Anyone else use timers for EVERYTHING? I set 25-min work blocks and it\'s a game changer. Pomodoro for the win! üçÖ
TIP: Put your phone in another room during deep work. Out of sight = out of mind. Finally finishing projects!
External scaffolding is my superpower! Visual reminders, apps, alarms - my environment remembers so I don\'t have to üìù
Started using \'implementation intentions\' - instead of \'I\'ll exercise\' I say \'At 7am, I put on shoes and walk\'. Works! üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Found a new safe food! These rice crackers have the perfect crunch without being too loud. Sharing the brand in comments üçò
Reminder that \'safe foods\' are valid! Sometimes plain pasta is self-care. No shame in eating what works for you üçù
I made a sensory-friendly recipe book! All recipes avoid common texture triggers. Would anyone want me to share it?
Does anyone else have \'safe restaurants\'? Places where you know exactly what to order and it\'s always consistent?
Batch cooking my safe foods on Sunday = less decision fatigue all week! Currently rotating 5 meals I actually enjoy üí™
Finally found a weighted blanket that doesn\'t make me overheat! Deep pressure + cool fabric = actually sleeping üò¥
Wind-down routine that works for my brain: dim lights, no screens 1hr before, same playlist every night. Consistency is key!
Anyone else\'s brain do the \'remember every embarrassing moment\' thing at 2am? Started journaling before bed to \'close tabs\'
White noise vs brown noise vs pink noise - which works for you? I\'m team brown noise, it\'s like a hug for my ears üîä
Started using blackout curtains AND a sleep mask. Totally dark room = finally getting deep sleep cycles!
New stim toy review! This textured fidget ring is SO satisfying. Quiet enough for meetings, stimmy enough for regulation ‚ú®
Normalize stimming in public! I was rocking at the grocery store and a kid said \'she\'s dancing!\' Made my day üíÉ
For my fellow oral stimmers - found chewable necklaces that look like actual jewelry. Discreet AND functional!
Movement is medicine! When I can\'t stim openly, I do toe-tapping under my desk. Subtle but still helps ü¶∂
Built a \'stim kit\' for my bag: putty, textured cards, fidget cube. Always prepared for regulation needs!
Loop earplugs CHANGED MY LIFE. Still hear conversations but takes the edge off sensory-overload environments üéß
Warm-toned light bulbs + dimmer switches made my home a safe haven. Harsh fluorescents are banned!
Spent an hour removing all clothing tags today. Worth every second. Why do brands make them so scratchy?! üëï
Unscented everything is the way. Made a list of truly fragrance-free products, happy to share!
Created a \'sensory map\' of my city - quiet cafes, low-stim stores, accessible escape routes. Super helpful! üó∫Ô∏è
Reminder: Meltdowns aren\'t \'bad behavior\' - they\'re nervous system overload. Be gentle with yourself after üíô
My meltdown kit: noise-canceling headphones, sunglasses, weighted lap pad, water, and a \'safe person\' contact
Learning my warning signs: irritability spike, sound sensitivity increase, physical tension. Catching it early helps!
Created a \'calm corner\' in my home with dim lights, soft textures, and NO demands. Essential recovery zone üè†
Post-meltdown self-care: rest, hydration, comfort food, and absolutely NO self-criticism. Recovery takes time üå∏
Scripts for small talk! \'How\'s your day going?\' ‚Üí \'Any fun weekend plans?\' ‚Üí \'That sounds nice!\' Memorized patterns help! üí¨
Quality over quantity. Having 2-3 close friends who \'get it\' is worth more than 100 acquaintances üë•
It\'s okay to leave social events early! \'I had a great time, heading out now\' - no long explanation needed üëã
\'I need to think about that\' is a complete sentence. No pressure to respond immediately!
Parallel play is valid adult friendship! Gaming together, crafting in the same room - connection without constant interaction
Finally dropping the mask at home. It\'s exhausting pretending to be \'normal\' all day. Safe spaces matter üé≠
Masking led to burnout. Now I\'m slowly learning who I am without the performance. It\'s scary but freeing
Found friends who accept the real me - stims, infodumps, and all. They say I\'m \'more interesting\' unmasked! ‚ú®
The price of masking: migraines, fatigue, identity confusion. Is \'fitting in\' worth my wellbeing? Reconsidering‚Ä¶
Started stimming publicly. Heart raced at first, but literally no one cared. The fear was bigger than reality üí™
Three hours researching dinosaur feather evolution and I regret NOTHING! Who wants to hear about Archaeopteryx? ü¶ï
My special interest is train schedules. I can tell you every stop on 47 metro lines. Ask me anything! üöÇ
Fungi are INCREDIBLE. Did you know there\'s a mushroom that can break down plastic? Mycelium is the future! üçÑ
When your special interest has lore, you BECOME the wiki. 400 hours in this game and still learning! üéÆ
Space facts incoming! A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus. Mind = blown every time I think about it ‚ú®
ADHD + anxiety is a rough combo. Tips that help me: structured routines, movement breaks, and lots of self-compassion üßò
Some days, just existing is an achievement. Be proud of the small wins. You\'re doing better than you think üíô
Finally found a neurodivergent-affirming therapist! They understand that \'just try harder\' isn\'t helpful. Game changer!
Journaling prompts for rough days: What\'s draining me? What\'s one kind thing I can do for myself right now?
Medication isn\'t a failure - it\'s a tool. Just like glasses for vision. No shame in chemical support üíä
Got my workplace accommodations approved! Noise-canceling headphones, flexible hours, written instructions. Know your rights! üíº
College disability services changed everything. Extra time, quiet testing rooms, note-taking support. Ask for help! üéì
WFH is my dream. No fluorescent lights, no open offices, no surprise social interactions. Productivity skyrocketed!
Cameras off in meetings when I need them. Standing during calls. These \'small\' accommodations make huge differences
Neurodivergent-friendly career paths: programming, research, art, writing, data analysis. Play to your strengths! üìà
Diagnosed at 35. Everything suddenly makes sense - the struggles, the differences, the \'quirks\'. Grief and relief mixed üîç
Spent decades thinking I was broken. Turns out I\'m just wired differently. Late diagnosis is still valid diagnosis üíú
Unmasking after 40 years is HARD. Who am I without the performance? Slowly rediscovering myself
Grieving the support I could have had growing up. But also grateful for finally understanding myself üå±
It\'s never too late to learn about yourself. Late-diagnosed at 52, and life is finally making sense!
The overlap between LGBTQ+ and ND communities is SO real! Finding people who understand BOTH identities is everything üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà‚ôæÔ∏è
Happy to be queer AND neurodivergent! Both are part of who I am, and both are valid and beautiful ‚ú®
Research shows ND folks are more likely to be LGBTQ+. We break the mold in so many ways! üíú
This space accepting ALL of me without questions is healing. Thank you for being here üôè
Whether you\'re figuring out identity, already out, or just supporting - you belong here! üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà
Being trans AND autistic means processing identity on multiple levels. It\'s complex but beautiful üè≥Ô∏è‚Äç‚ößÔ∏è
ND brains often experience gender differently. Our journeys are valid even if they\'re not \'typical\' üíôüíóü§ç
Name and pronoun stickers in my profile! Respect is non-negotiable here üè≥Ô∏è‚Äç‚ößÔ∏è
Navigating healthcare as trans AND ND can be extra challenging. Let\'s share resources and support! üí™
Finally living as my true self. The ND community has been incredibly welcoming. Grateful üíú
Pride month may be June, but we celebrate ALL year! Queer joy is ND-friendly joy üåà‚ú®
Sensory-friendly pride events are the BEST. Pride with ear plugs and sunglasses! üéâüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà
Remember: you don\'t need to \'prove\' your identity to anyone. Your experience is valid! üíñ
Celebrating queer joy today! What makes you happy about being part of this community? üéä
Learning LGBTQ+ history has been my special interest this month. So much to celebrate and honor! üìöüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà
Asexual AND autistic - the \'double A\' club! Understanding both has been a journey of self-discovery üñ§ü§çüíú
Aromantic spectrum representation matters! QPRs, chosen families, and friendship-centered lives are beautiful üíö
Gray-ace, demi, aego - so many ways to experience (or not experience) attraction. All valid! üñ§ü©∂ü§çüíú
Not experiencing attraction the \'typical\' way doesn\'t make us broken. Different is just different üíú
Ace week resources coming up! Educational content and community stories to share üñ§ü©∂ü§çüíú
Non-binary and neurodivergent! Gender is a construct I\'m happily deconstructing üíõü§çüíúüñ§
They/them pronouns please! Our community respects everyone\'s identity üíú
Some days more femme, some days more masc, some days ??? And all of it is valid! ‚ú®
Finding gender-affirming clothing that\'s also sensory-friendly is an adventure! Share your finds! üëï
It took me years to understand my gender. ND brain + gender exploration = complex but worth it üíõü§çüíúüñ§
Coming out as both ND and queer to my family was terrifying but freeing. You do it on YOUR timeline! üö™üíú
This community is a safe space to explore. You don\'t have to have all the answers yet üíô
Sharing coming out stories helps others feel less alone. Comment yours if you\'re comfortable! üåà
Not sure about labels yet and that\'s okay! Questioning is part of the journey, not the end üíú
Chosen family when bio family doesn\'t understand. The ND+LGBTQ+ community has your back üè†üíú
Welcome to this community! Share your experiences and support each other. We\'re all in this together üíô
Remember: everyone\'s journey is different. What works for one person might not work for another, and that\'s okay!
Great resources in the pinned post! Check them out if you\'re new here üìö
This is a judgment-free zone. Ask questions, share struggles, celebrate wins. We\'ve got you! üåü
New members: introduce yourself! What brings you here? What do you hope to learn or share?
These topics bring them joy - ask about them!
When you share photos or videos, they\'ll appear here.
Be the first to share your thoughts!
